intro: Oxydectes morifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery-green leaves and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive foliage and blooms. Oxydectes morifolia is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
